org.kiji.rest.util
Class RowResourceUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.rest.util.RowResourceUtil

@ApiAudience.Framework
public final class RowResourceUtil
extends Object

Utility methods used for reading and writing REST row model objects to/from Kiji.

Method Detail

getTimestamps

public static long[] getTimestamps(String timeRange)
Retrieves the Min..Max timestamp given the user specified time range. Min and Max represent long-type time in milliseconds since the UNIX Epoch. e.g. '123..1234', '0..', or '..1234'. (Default=0..)

Parameters:
timeRange - is the user supplied timerange.
Returns:
A long 2-tuple containing the min and max timestamps (in ms since UNIX Epoch)

addColumnDefs

public static List<org.kiji.schema.KijiColumnName> addColumnDefs(org.kiji.schema.layout.KijiTableLayout tableLayout,
                                                                 org.kiji.schema.KijiDataRequestBuilder.ColumnsDef columnsDef,
                                                                 String requestedColumns)
Returns a list of fully qualified KijiColumnNames to return to the client.

Parameters:
tableLayout - is the layout of the table from which the row is being fetched.
columnsDef - is the columns definition object being modified to be passed down to the KijiTableReader.
requestedColumns - the list of user requested columns to display.
Returns:
the list of KijiColumns that will ultimately be displayed. Since this method validates the list of incoming columns, it's not necessarily the case that what was specified in the requestedColumns string correspond exactly to the list of outgoing columns. In some cases it could be less (in case of an invalid column/qualifier) or more in case of specifying only the family but no qualifiers.

getKijiRestRow

public static KijiRestRow getKijiRestRow(org.kiji.schema.KijiRowData rowData,
                                         org.kiji.schema.layout.KijiTableLayout tableLayout,
                                         List<org.kiji.schema.KijiColumnName> columnsRequested,
                                         org.kiji.schema.KijiSchemaTable schemaTable)
                                  throws IOException
Reads the KijiRowData retrieved and returns the POJO representing the result sent to the client.

Parameters:
rowData - is the actual row data fetched from Kiji
tableLayout - the layout of the underlying Kiji table itself.
columnsRequested - is the list of columns requested by the client
schemaTable - is the handle to the schema table used to resolve the writer's schema into the Kiji specific UID.
Returns:
The Kiji row data POJO to be sent to the client
Throws:
IOException - when trying to request the specs of a column family that doesn't exist. Although this shouldn't happen as columns are assumed to have been validated before this method is invoked.

getKijiRowData

public static org.kiji.schema.KijiRowData getKijiRowData(org.kiji.schema.KijiTable table,
                                                         org.kiji.schema.EntityId eid,
                                                         org.kiji.schema.KijiDataRequest request)
                                                  throws IOException
Returns a Kiji row object given the table, entity_id and data request.

Parameters:
table - is the table containing the row.
eid - is the entity id of the row to return.
request - contains information about what to return.
Returns:
a Kiji row object conforming to the parameters of the request.
Throws:
IOException - if the retrieve fails.

putCell

public static void putCell(org.kiji.schema.KijiTableWriter writer,
                           org.kiji.schema.EntityId entityId,
                           String jsonValue,
                           org.kiji.schema.KijiColumnName column,
                           long timestamp,
                           org.apache.avro.Schema schema)
                    throws IOException
A helper method to perform individual cell puts.

Parameters:
writer - The table writer which will do the putting.
entityId - The entityId of the row to put to.
jsonValue - The json value to put.
column - The column to put the cell to.
timestamp - The timestamp to put the cell at (default is cluster-side UNIX time).
schema - The schema of the cell (default is specified in layout.).
Throws:
IOException - When the put fails.

writeRow

public static void writeRow(org.kiji.schema.KijiTable kijiTable,
                            org.kiji.schema.EntityId entityId,
                            KijiRestRow kijiRestRow,
                            org.kiji.schema.KijiSchemaTable schemaTable)
                     throws IOException
Util method to write a rest row into Kiji.

Parameters:
kijiTable - is the table to write into.
entityId - is the entity id of the row to write.
kijiRestRow - is the row model to write to Kiji.
schemaTable - is the handle to the schema table used to resolve the KijiRestCell's writer schema if it was specified as a UID.
Throws:
IOException - if there a failure writing the row.
